Category.name: remote station monitoring and control information

Category:
Message Type This Data Item allows for a more convenient handling of the messages at the receiver side by further defining the type of transaction.
MsgTyp Message Type Video Summary Message Video Message
Data Source Identifier Identification of the system from which the data are received.
SAC System Area Code
SIC System Identification Code
to do
Video Record Header Contains a message sequence identifier.
MSG_INDEX Message Sequence Identifier (video record cyclic counter)
to do
Video Summary Contains an ASCII string (free text to define stream meta data).
CHAR Character in ASCII representation
Video Header Nano Defines a group of video cells corresponding to a video radial: all cells have the same size in azimuth and range and are consecutive in range.
START_AZ Start azimuth of the cells group LSB = 360/2^16, Range: [0;360]
END_AZ End azimuth of the cells group LSB = 360/2^16, Range: [0;360]
START_RG Starting range of the cells group, expressed in number of cells. 0 is the radar location without any bias.
CELL_DUR Video cell duration in nano-seconds. LSB = 10^-9s s
Video Header Femto Defines a group of video cells corresponding to a video radial: all cells have the same size in azimuth and range and are consecutive in range.
START_AZ Start azimuth of the cells group LSB = 360/2^16, Range: [0;360]
END_AZ End azimuth of the cells group LSB = 360/2^16, Range: [0;360]
START_RG Starting range of the cells group, expressed in number of cells. 0 is the radar location without any bias.
CELL_DUR Video cell duration in femto-seconds. LSB = 10^-15s
Video Cells Resolution & Data Compression Indicator This Data Item defines the bit resolution used in the coding of the video signal amplitude in all cells of the video group as well as an indicator whether data compression has been applied.
C Data Compression Indicator No compression applied Compression applied
Spare Spare Bits set to zero
RES Bit resolution used for the coding of the amplitude of the video signal in every cell of a video group. Resolution: Monobit Resolution Coding Length in bits: 1 Resolution: Low Resolution Coding Length in bits: 2 Resolution: Medium Resolution Coding Length in bits: 4 Resolution: High Resolution Coding Length in bits: 8 Resolution: Very High Resolution Coding Length in bits: 16 Resolution: Ultra High Resolution Coding Length in bits: 32
to do
Video Octets & Video Cells Counters This Data Item contains the number of “valid” octets (i.e. non-empty octets) used in the coding of the video signal amplitude and the number of “valid” cells in the video group.
NB_VB Number of “valid” octets in the Video Block Data Volume Item; i.e. one of I240/050 or I240/051 or I240/052 whichever is present
NB_CELLS Number of “valid” cells in the Video Block Data Volume Item; i.e. one of I240/050 or I240/051 or I240/052 whichever is present
Video Block Low Data Volume Contains a group of video cells corresponding to a video radial; all cells have the same size in azimuth and range and are consecutive in range. This item shall be used in cases where a low data volume, up to 1020 bytes, will be transmitted.
VIDEO BLOCK Video signal amplitude of the cells in the group, coded according to the resolution defined in Item I240/048
to do
Video Block Medium Data Volume Contains a group of video cells corresponding to a video radial; all cells have the same size in azimuth and range and are consecutive in range. This item shall be used in cases where a medium data volume, up to 16320 bytes, will be transmitted.
VIDEO BLOCK Video signal amplitude of the cells in the group, coded according to the resolution defined in Item I240/048
to do
Video Block High Data Volume Contains a group of video cells corresponding to a video radial; all cells have the same size in azimuth and range and are consecutive in range. This item shall be used in cases where a high data volume, up to 65024 bytes, will be transmitted.
VIDEO BLOCK Video signal amplitude of the cells in the group, coded according to the resolution defined in Item I240/048
to do
Time of Day Absolute time stamping as UTC.
ToD Time of Day s
